TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableEntityAdapter`1<T> extends Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Table.TableEntity

Docs.typeparam: The type of object to read and write to Azure Table Storage, it can be a class or a struct.
Docs.summary: Adapter class to allow reading and writing objects to Azure Table Storage without inheriting from class or implementing interface. The objects can be simple POCO objects or complex objects with nested complex properties.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ReadEntity(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Table.EntityProperty> properties, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.OperationContext operationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that maps property names to typed values.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
Docs.summary: Deserializes instance using the specified that maps property names of the to typed values and stores it in the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Table.EntityProperty> WriteEntity(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.OperationContext operationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents the context for the current operation.
Docs.summary: Serializes the of property names mapped to data values from the property.
Docs.returns: An object that maps string property names to typed values created by serializing this table entity instance.
Docs.remarks:
If is a simple POCO object with simple properties (primitive types, string, byte[], ...), method will create objects using these properties.
Ie. A simple POCO object A with properties of B and C with this structure A->B, A->C, will be converted to key value pairs of {"B", EntityProperty(B)}, {"C", EntityProperty(C)}.
If has complex properties (and potentially these properties having complex properties of their own), method will flatten first.
Ie. An object A with a simple property of B and complex properties of C and D which have their own properties of E and F with this structure A->B, A->C->E and A->D->F, will be flattened to key value pairs of:
{"B", EntityProperty(B)}, {"C_E", EntityProperty(E)} and {"D_F", EntityProperty(F)}.
For each key value pair:
1. The key is composed by appending the names of the properties visited from root (A) to end node property (E or F) delimited by "_".
2. The value is the object, instantiated by the value of the end node property.
All key value pairs will be stored in the returned .
method recomposes the original object (POCO or complex) using the returned by this method and store it in property.
Properties that are marked with in the object will be ignored and not processed by this method.
